raw_comment: Something that immediately sticks out to the reader is the greater income the greater the chance is to be accepted. The question on my mind is, do we understand the effect of this habit? If we only go based on income then we miss the opportunity to see something extraordinary in the greater half of the population. It is eye opening yet underwhelming to see such potential deminissed.
ace_sentences: A reader immediately notices a pattern.
A greater income increases the chance of acceptance.
Do we understand the effect of this habit?
We may base decisions only on income.
If we base decisions only on income then we miss an opportunity.
The opportunity is to see something extraordinary in more than half of the population.
It is eye-opening to see such potential diminished.
It is underwhelming to see such potential diminished.
